meanings.definition: A mystery story or play in which the identity of the perpetrator is revealed at the end.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed watching the whodunnit movie and guessing who the culprit was.
meanings.sent2: She read a thrilling whodunnit novel that kept her guessing until the final chapter.
meanings.sent3: During the party, they decided to create a whodunnit game to entertain their guests.
meanings.sent4: The whodunnit plot twisted and turned like a maze, keeping the audience on edge.
meanings.sent5: The whodunnit story was so captivating that she couldn't put the book down.

meanings.definition: A genre of fiction characterized by the solving of a crime or mystery by a detective.
meanings.sent1: The bookstore had a whole section dedicated to whodunnit novels for mystery lovers.
meanings.sent2: He enjoyed the challenge of figuring out the whodunnit puzzle presented in the detective story.
meanings.sent3: The detective in the whodunnit story had a quirky sidekick who added humor to their investigations.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a whodunnit plot, with unexpected twists and turns at every corner.
meanings.sent5: The whodunnit genre always kept him engaged with its clever plots and suspenseful endings.
